DOC.HEAD: Nicaragua Threatens `Traitors' If United States Invades
With AM-Panama, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: The Defense Ministry said Wednesday all those supporting U.S. military intervention in Central America will be ``neutralized, cut off and executed'' if the United States attacks Nicaragua. The threat by the ruling leftist Sandinista government was not specific, but appeared aimed at the 14-party National Opposition Union coalition and its presidential candidate, Violeta Chamorro, in national elections Feb. 25. The warning came in a special communique to all military units broadcast over government radio and part of a maximum alert of armed forces ordered Dec. 20 by President Daniel Ortega, hours after the U.S. invasion of Panama. It said that at the start of any ``Yankee intervention,'' all units are ordered ``to apply plans to neutralize, cut off and execute all recalcitrant traitors who openly or covertly have been encouraging such Yankee intervention.'' Earlier Wednesday, the Sandinista newspaper Barricada said Nicaragua will not let a U.S. plane carrying monthly supplies for the U.S. Embassy land as scheduled on Jan. 11. Foreign Minister Miguel D'Escoto told U.S. Secretary of State James Baker III Tuesday night the measure was taken because U.S. forces would not let Nicaraguan planes land in Panama and surrounded the Nicaraguan Embassy in Panama City, Barricada said. U.S. Embassy spokesman Lou Falino said he had no comment. Last week, Nicaraguan troops surrounded the U.S. Embassy in Managua in response to Nicaragua's embassy in Panama being surrounded. U.S. officials were trying to prevent any effort by ousted Panamanian strongman Gen. Manuel Antonio Noriega to flee to that embassy. Instead, he took refuge in the Vatican embassy.
